description: An ancient settlement in northwest Jordan (modern Amman) received a Macedonian settlement and the name of Philadelphia from Ptolemy II Philadelphos (285-246 BC). The modern Amman, Jordan.

history.comment: Location updates and tags from Johan Ahlfeldt's (jahlfeldt) Digital Atlas of the Roman Empire in October 2012

Fixing modern/alt locations fumbled in intial import

names.description: Name of Amman in Neo-Assyrian sources.

history.comment: Updated information. The name resource https://pleiades.stoa.org/places/697728/bit-ammana-arc should be retracted since it is a duplicate and the name record is actually Akkadian, not Aramaic.

names.description: Name of Amman/Philadelpheia in an administrative document dating to the reign of the seventh-century-BC Assyrian king Ashurbanipal.

names.description: Ethnic name used to designate a person from Bīt-Ammān in Neo-Assyrian sources, including royal inscriptions of Tiglath-pileser III (r. 745-727 BC) and Sennacherib (r. 704-681 BC).
